intro: Neomirandea biflora, commonly known as the two-flowered mirandea, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Mirandellaceae and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and pale pink. The plant has small, narrow leaves arranged in a rosette pattern, and it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Neomirandea biflora is considered a species of conservation concern. Its unique morphology and restricted range make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
